gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: d15N NO3 from the U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT,EPZT Nitrogen Isotopes projects of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Nitrate isotope data from the US GEOTRACES EPZT cruise. Dataset Description: <p>Nitrate isotope data from the US GEOTRACES EPZT cruise.</p><p><strong>Related publications and references: </strong><br />Casciotti, K. L., D. M. Sigman, M. Galanter Hastings, J. K. Bohlke, and A. Hilkert. 2002. Measurement of the oxygen isotopic composition of nitrate in seawater and freshwater using the denitrifier method. Analytical Chemistry 74:<strong>&nbsp;</strong>4905-4912. doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1021/ac020113w" target="_blank">10.1021/ac020113w</a></p><p>Granger, J. and D. M. Sigman. 2009. Removal of nitrite with sulfamic acid for nitrate N and O isotope analysis with the denitrifier method. Rapid Communications in Mass Spectrometry 23: 3753-3762. doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/rcm.4307" target="_blank">10.1002/rcm.4307</a></p><p>McIlvin, M., and K. L. Casciotti. 2011. Technical updates to the bacterial method for nitrate isotopic analyses. Analytical Chemistry 83: 1850-1856. doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1021/ac1028984" target="_blank">10.1021/ac1028984</a></p><p>Sigman, D. M., K. L. Casciotti, M. Andreani, C. Barford, M. Galanter, and J. K. Bohlke. 2001. A bacterial method for the nitrogen isotopic analysis of nitrate in seawater and freshwater. Analytical Chemistry 73:<strong>&nbsp;</strong>4145-4153. doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1021/ac010088e" target="_blank">10.1021/ac010088e</a></p> Acquisition Description: <p><strong>Sampling</strong>: Full depth and super station samples were collected from the ship's rosette. Samples were filtered through 0.8/0.45 um acropak5 00 filter cartridges into triple-rinsed 60 mL HDPE bottles. Demi station samples were collected from the GETORACES Go-Flo rosette. Samples were filtered through 0.2 um acropak capsule filters into triple-rinsed 60 mL HDPE bottles. Each sample was collected in triplicate. Samples were frozen at -20 C immediately and stored frozen until analysis.</p><p><strong>Analysis</strong>: Samples were analyzed for nitrate d15N using the denitrifier method (Sigman et al., 2001; Casciotti, et al., 2001, with technical updates described by McIlvin and Casciotti, 2011). In the Casciotti Lab, Nitrate isotope reference materials USGS32 and USGS34 were used to calibrate d15N. Each sample was analyzed 2-6 times. Mean and standard deviations are reported for each sample. Samples were analyzed either on a DeltaPLUS XP or DeltaV PLUS isotope ratio mass spectrometer (IRMS), both with custom-built inlets described in McIlvin and Casciotti, 2011. Where possible (concentrations exceeded 2 uM), samples and standards were analyzed in 20 nanomole aliquots. When NO3- concentrations were below 2 uM, samples were injected in maximum volume (10 mL) and calibrated using interpolations between standard curves of 5 and 20 nano moles NO3-. Samples containing nitrate concentrations lower than 0.3 uM were not analyzed.&nbsp;Samples containing measurable NO2- concentrations were treated with sulfuric acid prior to analysis (Granger and Sigman, 2009).</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1233339 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1233339

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Department of Environmental Earth System Science 473 Via Ortega, Room 143

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: Eastern Tropical Pacific - Transect from Peru to Tahiti

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: U.S. GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect

gmd:name.gmx:Anchor: U.S. GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Description from NSF award abstract:Nitrogen (N) is an essential macronutrient whose availability can limit primary production and the capacity of the biological pump to export carbon from the surface ocean on seasonal, annual, decadal, and millennial timescales. The inventory of fixed (bioavailable) N in the ocean is driven by biological processes such as nitrogen fixation, denitrification, and anaerobic ammonia oxidation (anammox). Water column oxygen deficient zones (ODZs) are important sites for fixed N loss, as well as N2O production, and they are projected to expand and intensify in the coming years as global warming increases ocean stratification and decreases ventilation. It is important to understand the distribution of nitrate, nitrite, and N2O isotopes in relation to current ocean conditions of oxygen and trace element availability order to interpret past and future changes in nitrate signals.In this project, a team of researchers from Stanford University, University of Massachusetts at Dartmouth, and Brown University will measure the nitrogen- and oxygen-isotopic composition (del15N and del18O) of nitrate, nitrite, and nitrous oxide in seawater samples collected along the GEOTRACES Pacific Peru-Tahiti Section. Values of del15N and del18O will also be measured in nitrate from aerosol and rain samples to inform our interpretation of the N isotope budget and isotopic gradients within the tropical South Pacific. Finally, N2/Ar and N2 del15N will be determined to close the N mass and isotope budgets. Nitrate del15N is a GEOTRACES "core parameter" that will complement other measurements, such as bioactive trace element concentrations and speciation, Si isotope variations, as well as redox and productivity proxies.The GEOTRACES Peru-Tahiti section provides a rare opportunity to track the fate of the isotopic signals of N loss from one of the largest water column ODZs. Furthermore, little is known about the effect of N recycling through hydrothermal vents on nitrate isotopes in the deep ocean, and this section will allow quantitative tracking of this input. Together, these measurements will yield insight into the relative rates of modern N cycle processes and will provide background information for paleoceanographic applications.
Eastern Tropical Pacific - Transect from Peru to Tahiti

values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650254.rdf Name: GEOTRC_EVENTNO Units: unitless Description: GEOTRACES event number; values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650255.rdf Name: CASTNO Units: unitless Description: Cast number; values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650256.rdf Name: ISO_DATETIME_UTC_START_EVENT Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z Description: Date and time, formatted to the ISO 8601 standard, at the start of the sampling event, according to the event log. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650257.rdf Name: EVENT_LAT Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude at the start of the event (according to the event log); north is positive; values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650258.rdf Name: EVENT_LON Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude at the start of the event (according to the event log); east is positive; values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650259.rdf Name: GEOTRC_INSTR Units: unitless Description: Sampling instrument; values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650260.rdf Name: GEOTRC_SAMPNO Units: unitless Description: Unique GEOTRACES sample number http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650261.rdf Name: DEPTH_PI Units: meters Description: Sampling depth, provided by the PI. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650262.rdf Name: NO3_15_D_DELTA_BOTTLE Units: permil Description: Average nitrate delta 15N, reported in units of permil vs. atmospheric N2. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650263.rdf Name: NO3_15_D_DELTA_BOTTLE_STDEV Units: permil Description: Standard deviation of nitrate delta 15N analysis, reported in units of permil vs. atmospheric N2. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650264.rdf Name: num_of_analyses Units: dimensionless Description: The number of replicates analyzed for a given sample. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650265.rdf Name: NO3_15_D_DELTA_BOTTLE_FLAG Units: dimensionless Description: NO3_15_D_DELTA_BOTTLE quality flag. 1 indicates that the sample was treated with sulfamic acid ; 2 indicates that the nitrate concentration of the sample was too low for delta 15N analysis ; 3 indicates that no sample was collected. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650266.rdf Name: SAMPNO Units: unitless Description: Sequential sample number within the cast (usually corresponds to bottle number); values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650267.rdf Name: BTLNBR Units: unitless Description: Bottle number; typically 1-24; values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650268.rdf Name: BTLNBR_FLAG_W Units: unitless Description: Bottle number quality flag; follows WOCE conventions. 2 = good; 3 = questionable; 4 = bad; 9 = missing data; values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650269.rdf Name: BTL_ISO_DATETIME_UTC Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z Description: Date and time, formatted to the ISO 8601 standard, at the time of bottle firing; values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650270.rdf Name: BTL_LAT Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude of bottle firing; north is positive; values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650271.rdf Name: BTL_LON Units: decimal degrees Description: Lonitude of bottle firing; east is positive; values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650272.rdf Name: ODF_CTDPRS Units: decibars Description: The ODF software acquisition measurement of pressure; values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650273.rdf Name: SMDEPTH Units: meters Description: Saunders-Mantyla depth (integrated; uses dynamic height); values added from the EPZT master file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650274.rdf Name: FMDEPTH Units: meters Description: Fofonoff-Millard depth (non-integrated; gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Cruise identification; General Description: cruise designation; name
PI-supplied Description: Station number; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES event number; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.
PI-supplied Description: Cast number; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: cast or profile number

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time, formatted to the ISO 8601 standard, at the start of the sampling event, according to the event log.; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Latitude at the start of the event (according to the event log); north is positive; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude at the start of the event (according to the event log); east is positive; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Sampling instrument; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: instrument used to collect or process data, definition is specific to the data set in which it appears

PI-supplied Description: Unique GEOTRACES sample number; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Sampling depth, provided by the PI.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.
PI-supplied Description: Average nitrate delta 15N, reported in units of permil vs. atmospheric N2.; General Description: delta 15N of dissolved nitrate relative to atmospheric N2

PI-supplied Description: Standard deviation of nitrate delta 15N analysis, reported in units of permil vs. atmospheric N2.; General Description: Generic standard deviation value, taking on the units of the parameter that it is tied to.
PI-supplied Description: The number of replicates analyzed for a given sample.; General Description: Number of replicate samples in an experimental procedure, test, or calculation.

PI-supplied Description: NO3_15_D_DELTA_BOTTLE quality flag. 1 indicates that the sample was treated with sulfamic acid ; 2 indicates that the nitrate concentration of the sample was too low for delta 15N analysis ; 3 indicates that no sample was collected.; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

PI-supplied Description: Sequential sample number within the cast (usually corresponds to bottle number); values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Bottle number; typically 1-24; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Bottle number quality flag; follows WOCE conventions. 2 = good; 3 = questionable; 4 = bad; 9 = missing data; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time, formatted to the ISO 8601 standard, at the time of bottle firing; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Latitude of bottle firing; north is positive; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Lonitude of bottle firing; east is positive; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: The ODF software acquisition measurement of pressure; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

PI-supplied Description: Saunders-Mantyla depth (integrated; uses dynamic height); values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Fofonoff-Millard depth (non-integrated; also used by SBE); values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.
PI-supplied Description: Bottom depth; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: bottom depth

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: CTD pressure; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

PI-supplied Description: CTD bottle firing depth; values added from the EPZT master file.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p><strong>Sampling</strong>: Full depth and super station samples were collected from the ship's rosette. Samples were filtered through 0.8/0.45 um acropak5 00 filter cartridges into triple-rinsed 60 mL HDPE bottles. Demi station samples were collected from the GETORACES Go-Flo rosette. Samples were filtered through 0.2 um acropak capsule filters into triple-rinsed 60 mL HDPE bottles. Each sample was collected in triplicate. Samples were frozen at -20 C immediately and stored frozen until analysis.</p><p><strong>Analysis</strong>: Samples were analyzed for nitrate d15N using the denitrifier method (Sigman et al., 2001; Casciotti, et al., 2001, with technical updates described by McIlvin and Casciotti, 2011). In the Casciotti Lab, Nitrate isotope reference materials USGS32 and USGS34 were used to calibrate d15N. Each sample was analyzed 2-6 times. Mean and standard deviations are reported for each sample. Samples were analyzed either on a DeltaPLUS XP or DeltaV PLUS isotope ratio mass spectrometer (IRMS), both with custom-built inlets described in McIlvin and Casciotti, 2011. Where possible (concentrations exceeded 2 uM), samples and standards were analyzed in 20 nanomole aliquots. When NO3- concentrations were below 2 uM, samples were injected in maximum volume (10 mL) and calibrated using interpolations between standard curves of 5 and 20 nano moles NO3-. Samples containing nitrate concentrations lower than 0.3 uM were not analyzed.&nbsp;Samples containing measurable NO2- concentrations were treated with sulfuric acid prior to analysis (Granger and Sigman, 2009).</p>

<p><strong>Data Processing</strong>: Raw data were calibrated to USGS standards analyzed 6x with each batch of samples. The measured values of these reference materials were used to calibrated the measured d15N&nbsp;values to the atmospheric N2 reference scale (McIlvin and Casciotti, 2011).</p><p><strong>BCO-DMO Processing:</strong><br />- modified parameter names to conform with BCO-DMO naming conventions;<br />- replaced blanks (no data) with 'nd';<br />- replaced -999 with 'nd';<br />- joined to EPZT master file (details below).</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing by BCO-DMO:</strong><br />As was done for the GEOTRACES-NAT data, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters:<br />cruise_id, EXPOCODE,SECT_ID, STNNBR,&nbsp;CASTNO, GEOTRC_EVENTNO, GEOTRC_SAMPNO, GEOTRC_INSTR, SAMPNO, GF_NO, BTLNBR, BTLNBR_FLAG_W, DATE_START_EVENT, TIME_START_EVENT, ISO_DATETIME_UTC_START_EVENT, EVENT_LAT, EVENT_LON, DEPTH_MIN, DEPTH_MAX, &nbsp;BTL_DATE, BTL_TIME, BTL_ISO_DATETIME_UTC, BTL_LAT, BTL_LON, ODF_CTDPRS, SMDEPTH, FMDEPTH, BTMDEPTH, CTDPRS, CTDDEPTH.</p><p>This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter-comparison of the datasets.</p><p>Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle and ODF_Bottle datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the TN303 Event Log (version 30 Oct 2014). Where applicable, pump information was taken from the PUMP_Nuts_Sals dataset.</p><p>A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.</p><p>If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.</p><p>See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: IRMS PI Supplied Instrument Description:Samples were analyzed either on a DeltaPLUS XP or DeltaV PLUS isotope ratio mass spectrometer (IRMS). Instrument Name: Isotope-ratio Mass Spectrometer Instrument Short Name:IR Mass Spec Instrument Description: The Isotope-ratio Mass Spectrometer is a particular type of mass spectrometer used to measure the relative abundance of isotopes in a given sample (e.g. VG Prism II Isotope Ratio Mass-Spectrometer). Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB16/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Go-Flo Instrument Name: GO-FLO Teflon Trace Metal Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Teflon TM Instrument Description: GO-FLO Teflon-lined Trace Metal free sampling bottles are used for collecting water samples for trace metal, nutrient and pigment analysis. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is designed specifically to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
